-----Original Message-----
From: Humberto Sanchez [mailto:sbloans@bellsouth.net]
Sent: Saturday, May 18, 2002 12:03 AM
To: Jeb Bush
Subject: SINGLE MOTHERS/HANDICAP PEOPLE EVICTED BY CORRUPTION????




Honorable Governor Bush.
 
Due to the urgency of this matter I feel you must act now.  This is in reference to the issue of dozens of low-income families, most of them single mothers, handicap people, and minorities being foreclosed at Miramar Gardens and Vista Verde. with all due respect, what is happening here is not inline with good governmental  policies, much less with State or US HUD policies. These families are being put out in the street with minor children, yet no official  have taken the lead to try to get to the bottom of this strange situation, although, the majority of these families are registered voters and the poor votes also counts.
 
The information that I got from someone who has been a homeowner there for 26 years, is that this is a low-income community, some of this families have been living there for 30 years, at the beginning, there was never a HOA, everyone maintained their own adjacent common areas near each unit, I single mother that I got to talk to claims that 26 years ago when she bought this unit there was no HOA, years went by and all of the sudden some strange happened. an association was imposed on them, then a receivership making mega thousands of dollars a year, and then a management company by force not by vote. I had the opportunity to see pictures of this neighborhood, although they are been force to pay a high tab, the common areas maintenance leaves a lot to be desired, now obviously people perceive that the management company imposed on them is not doing the job and is just charging for work not done, and I can see why, there is no even live grass, yet according to the homeowner, management paid for such regularly. There is another theory, that unscrupulous people are behind this situation trying to foreclose of these people in order to take control of the land. My understanding is that this community consist of over 500 townhomes, lots of families to be thrown to the streets. I wonder what is the real role of our government, help this hopeless families, just let these sharks eat them alive, or try to look for a positive and painless way of bringing the community back to where it was and protect these families and handicap people. US HUD and State of Florida spends millions of dollars every year from our tax dollars in order to provide  low-income housing, yet what is happening here is in very conflict with the policies. US HUD spent trillions on subsidy rents, and homeownership, so there is all types of programs, what is it in this case than apparently no positive approach has been taken??.  Do you feel someone should loose their homestead for a few hundred dollars or don't you think that arrangement could have been made to solve this situation. I was provided with documentation than reveals the manager and the foreclosing attorney are principals in a corporation with 50% interest each. Once again, I suggest that this case is worth a few hours of FDLE investigation since now with this imposed association the community is regulated by state laws. For all these reasons, I previously respectfully requested from you that something needs to be done at state level and you have the power of issuing an executive order to protect not only these families but all Floridians who live in regulated properties. I just got another e-mail today describing a newspaper article with another foreclosure in Orlando for $161.00, what's going on? For now, thru a network of good Samaritan, news organizations, community organization and others, I will continue to keep track of all these cases for future reference, as I Informed you before, prominent pro-Hispanics organizations will be raising these issues soon. 
 
May the lord bless you and your families that have a comfortable and secure place to live.

Jeb

This Thursday my wife and I attended a friends sons HS graduation at one
of

adults
sitting behind us--it appeared that they likely graduated ( or dropped
out)

comes after the letter "O""?  My wife and I just looked at each other in

ourselves

-----Original Message-----
From: Sandra (Kip) Liles [mailto:Truly-Momma@webtv.net]
Sent: Friday, May 17, 2002 11:18 AM
To: Jeb Bush
Subject: DCFS - PLEASE Take The Time To Read


Gov. Bush,                                               

     As a former foster "mommy" to over 200 children and presently a
Citizen Review Panel member for the 10th Judicial Circuit in Polk County
(Florida), I am extremely concerned and interested in the problems that
are occurring (and have been for years) within DCFS.                    

     I know that since at least 1989, our former Governor's have also
formed numerous panels/committee's to look into DCFS and their problems.
This is an excellent idea. However, I feel that if you want to find out
what is REALLY going on within the "system" that you need to talk with
the people that have "been in the trenches" and know first hand what is
truly going on. It does very little good to just talk to and question
the "higher ups" within DCFS - talk to the people that have lived within
and deal directly with DCFS - this is where you will find out the true
story and hopefully ways to help.               

     I am not writing you to "bash" DCFS. They have some wonderful
people working there; a horrific and impossible job to do; and no, I
would not do their job for ANY amount of money. Speaking of money, yes,
that is an issue. Unfortunately though, money is not going to, by
itself, solve all of the problems that they are facing. More monies seem
to be allocated every time there is a major crisis that makes the news,
and new "rules and/or laws" are made. However, NOTHING really changes.                         

    As a member of the Citizen Review Panel, let me give you a few
examples of the problems I have seen (money has very little to do with
what I am sharing with you). These situations are nothing but
irresponsibility on the part of DCFS.     
1. We heard a case where the children were left in the home under
Protective Services. When we got to court for the hearing we found out
that the case had been CLOSED because "the family had moved and the
caseworker did not know where they were". Of course, nobody bothered to
check to see if Dad was still employed at the mines where he had worked
for many year or checked with the Police Dept. (very small town) to see
if they might know where they were. They did not check with the schools
to see if the children were still enrolled!!!!!!! When the DCFS Attorney
was questioned (caseworker was not at hearing) her comment was something
to the effect that "they figured the children were OK since there had
been no recent reports to the child abuse hotline". Of course, my remark
to her was that the next call to the hotline might be in reference to
the death of a child!!!!                                              
2. We heard another case in which the Mom had placed her child with a
friend before DCFS became involved. Later DCFS was called in and they
the baby in the home where the Mom had placed him. That was probably
fine - BUT, DCFS NEVER did a home study or background check on anyone
living in that home as required. I believe this child had been in the
friend's home for about a year by the time we heard the case (I can
verify the time frame if needed).                               
3. We saw children with severe behavioral problems being returned home
because "there was no place to put them". One child in particular had
been in every therapeutic home available and none of them would take him
again - so he was just returned home only to have to be returned to the
"system" again. Thankfully nothing serious (that we know of) happened to
him during the time he was back home.                                               
4. We saw children returned home with no order from the judge.                                 
5. DCFS workers would come into our hearings and have absolutely NO CLUE
as to what was going on in the case. We would be presented with a copy
of the Judicial Review which looked exactly like the Judicial Review we
had for that case a few months earlier - the ONLY changes on it would be
the date. These Judicial Reviews usually included "no new law violations
known." Of course, when questioned about any recent law violations they
never knew - they had not checked prior to coming into court or
preparing the Judicial Review. I finally started checking for new
violations myself the night before the hearing (on my computer) and
frequently found new violations and/or found out that a parent was
currently in jail.                                  
6. We had numerous cases in which 
DCFS had NOT done criminal background checks on adults living in the
home where the child was placed (either relative placement of friend).                                 
7. We had numerous cases where the caseworker had not done what the
judge had ordered after our previous hearing on that particular case.
They also had not followed through on the panels recommendation as they
had agreed to.   


8. I know of situations where DCFS has gone to the home in reference to
a hotline report, and when they find the parents not home (or they just
don't come to the door) DCFS will leave a note for the parent to call
them. It doesn't take a rocket scientist to figure out that if there is
a child in the home covered with bruises or the home is extremely
filthy, these parents are NOT going to call DCFS to come back and take a
look!!!!!!!!!                                              
9. I also know of cases where the children are in the home under
Protective Supervision and when the caseworker goes to the home the
parents say the child is sleeping; is at a neighbor's; etc. The
caseworker does not INSIST on seeing that child - they just report that
they made a visit. That is a big RED FLAG WARNING when this occurs; yet
it happens time after time.                            
10. Then you have the problem of judges returning children home AGAINST
the advice of DCFS. This is a another issue, and is certainly not the
fault of DCFS.        

     These are a few of the reasons WHY CHILDREN ARE DYING UNDER DCFS
SUPERVISION!!!!!!!! Please take the time to listen to some of the people
that are, or have been, involved "behind the scene".     

     If you, or any of your staff would like to take the time to discuss
this situation, I would be more than happy to help. I feel quite sure
that I could even get a small group of other Citizen Review Panel
members and foster parents to discuss these issues. I am willing to go
anywhere at anytime in reference to this. I am not looking for publicity
- I do not want publicity. I only want to see changes TRULY implemented
and adhered to for the safety of our children.                          

     I know this is lengthy, and for that I apologize. Thank you though
for taking the time to read this and I am sincere in my desire to help.                                     

    I gave up my foster care (Emergency Shelter Home) license after the
tragic case of Bradley McGee. Yes, he was one of "my" babies, and after
his death I just could not allow myself to go through the pain of taking
care of and loving these children, only to have NO SAY in what was in
"the child's best interest". Braddie lived with my family until he was
moved into his "long term" foster home. His death was truly horrific and
we hoped that because of his death, the system would change.
Unfortunately that did not happen, but I am still prayerful that it
will.  

     Please contact me at any time if I can help with the issues of
making DCFS more effective in protecting our children.    

Thank you.                                                

Sandra (Kip) Liles; 2500 21st St. NW #10; Winter Haven, Fl. 33881                             

863-294-3315

"A hundred years from now, it will not matter what kind of a car that I
drove or the sort of house that I lived in; but the world may be
diifferent  because I was important in the life of a child."
STOP CHILD ABUSE-NEVER FORGET Bradley McGee 6-6-87 / 7-28-89
*****************************************
*********************************************** THERE IS NO SOUND, NO
CRY IN ALL THE WORLD THAT CAN BE HEARD UNLESS SOMEONE IS LISTENING
*****REPORT CHILD ABUSE*****

-----Original Message-----
From: Rosemary N. Palmer [mailto:rnp@mstar2.net]
Sent: Saturday, May 18, 2002 12:44 PM
To: Jeb Bush
Subject: Foster care system


Dear Gov,
    As a former guardian ad litem and foster parent, I suggest the
following:
1.  One reason there are not more good foster homes is that in order to
foster properly every child in the home must have the same opportunity.
That means in all but the poorest homes, the existing children have to
forgo opportunity to allow the foster children to have some.  This is
because the foster care reimbursement is insufficient (when was the last
time you clothed a child for a year on $200?, much less the other
requirements).
2.  The system spends far too much time investigating complaints that
are false, diverting precious resources from situations that need
attention.  Even professional reports, and self-reports cannot be
counted on to be valid.   We ought to pay for education compaigns for
what parents are expected to do (if you are not feeding, sheltering,
speaking kindly to, loving, teaching your children right from wrong,
demonstrating good work ethic, making sure they get to school clean and
neatly dressed, and know where and with whom they are, you need to fix
it or let someone raise your children who will.  If you are calling your
children derogatory names, hitting them, pulling their hair, hurting or
humiliating them, losing your temper in front of them, letting them
disobey the laws or behave badly without consequence, exposing them to
sex or violence, or leaving them to to their own devices, you must
either quit or let someone raise your children who will.)
3.  The law that forces reporting of child on child sexual abuse cases
by counselors, even when there is no reason to suspect any parental
involvement forces parents who want to protect their children from
public knowledge of the problem, cannot get counseling for them.  Isn't
the best case that children who are victims or perpetrators of sexual
abuse get therapy?  Then why have a reporting system that (1)
discourages it; and (2) must spend lots of time and energy on cases
which do not offer any additional protection to the public or the child.

4.  Although I am not persuaded this is a government function, I would
love to see powerful leaders give a serious of talks in which they
acknowledge that personal choice aside, part of the reason why child on
child and other sexual abuse is increasing is that pornography is too
available, clothes are too skimpy, advertisements are too sexual, movies
are too raunchy; lyrics are too graphic.  If we really want to keep our
children safe, we must voluntarily curtail these influences.
5.  Why don't you issue a Executive Order designating one day a week as
family night?  Discourage any scheduled meetings or activities on that
night.  Turn out the lights in state buildings for all except critical
workers.  Ask cities and counties to join you in the effort.  Encourage
families to spend that one night together.    You are right,
strengthening families will be far most cost effective than anything
government can do AFTER families get in trouble.
Rosemary N. Palmer


From:	Moore, Tim <TimMoore@fdle.state.fl.us>
Sent:	Sunday, May 19, 2002 12:00 PM
To:	Jeb Bush
Cc:	Kathleen M. Shanahan (E-mail); David Struhs (E-mail); Dawley, Joyce
Subject:	Threat on Water Supply in Orlando

We received a general threat against the "drinking water system" for Orlando.  The Orlando Regional Domestic Security Task Force received this  information in the early morning hours today via the FBI.  The source of the threat originated in Germany via the internet through French Yahoo to the CIA Bulletin Board.
 
Efforts have been completed to take necessary precautions for the 30 water supply sources in Orange County (28 of which are routinely unmanned). All managers of these operations have been contacted and local law enforcement are currently manning all locations and will until further notice.
 
At this point, no real specifics to the threat and no identification of the source.  The FBI, who is a member of our DSTF, is working this angle.
 
Local gov't officials who need to know have been briefed, and i talked to David Struhs earlier this morning as  a heads up.
 
Will keep you informed on meaningful developments.
 
tim

From:	Matt Conroy <Matt@cfl.rr.com>
Sent:	Sunday, May 19, 2002 1:02 PM
To:	Jeb Bush
Subject:	RE: Florida Today-A Special Report

You are welcome.

As I was reading some of these articles on funding--IE: the discrepancy gaps such as who is willing to pay more as opposed to those who believe education is under funded.  May I suggest that we create a special state education fund where anyone can donate to for education by specific category: Scholarships, Teacher Pay (perhaps for increased performance), Facilities, Special Programs, to Specific school etc.  Under current federal tax law, it would be considered a charitable contribution and deductible.  Local groups, businesses, teachers unions or individuals could raise or provide funds etc and target for whatever they consider a need.  I realize there is nothing in current tax laws to prevent anyone from donating now to any school or schools foundation now, however I am not aware of a specific funding mechanism managed by the state for the specific purpose which would allow individuals or groups to target specific categories as opposed to dollars going into a general fund where who knows where it goes.  Provisions should also be made that no educational dollars could be supplanted as has been the case with the lottery.  This may also provide a means to for all of those people (72% in the Florida Today survey) who believe education is woefully under funded, to put their money where their mouth is!!  Just a thought.

Also in reading the state stats on graduation rates this morning--it would be interesting to see if all Florida districts use the same formulas and data aggregation for determining graduation and dropout rates.  This topic has always deeply concerned me that any district in the US manipulate stats to show how great they are doing when in fact the students are not truly receiving the services that the public is led to believe.  I am asking because I don't know--do we have extremely rigid formulas in Florida that districts MUST use to calculate dropout and also graduation rates for consistency district to district and consequently state to state?  If so, do we have any follow up teams to verify stats and how the data for the stats were aggregated? This accuracy and consistency of this info is vital in deterring and evaluating the services we are providing our kids.

An update on our electronic course career, college, scholarship planning and registration program. We have taken the planning request forms from High School/High Tech pilot students this past week--and as soon as our data entry clerk completes entering the program of study data we will make a run of the student worksheets in preparation to work with the pilot group students when they return in the fall to personalize their HS courses based on their college, career and scholarship plans. Remember--undecided is OK--clueless is not! :-)  62% of Florida 9th graders do not graduate HS and we are ranked 47th in education---I absolutely believe these revised guidance procedures and use of these new tech tools can make a dramatic change for Florida students and have committed myself to making this work! Every Florida Student and parent needs to be aware of every opportunity available to them and have the ability to adequately plan and prepare for them.  Thanks to your e-mail to Mr. Horne last month, some of his staff folks have e-mailed and called--we are now trying to put together a date for some of them to come over this summer.  Everything we are putting together has been done with it in mind so it is easily replicated and used in order to get into the hands of schools and kids as easily and quickly as possible.  

Have a good day--and its been raining hard here today--boy did we need that!!  Looks like most of the state is getting some good rain--finally.

Matt

From:	Nancy Ann Wuesthoff <ladyrose@tampabay.rr.com>
Sent:	Sunday, May 19, 2002 1:07 PM
To:	Jeb Bush
Subject:	Our Veterans Hospitals
Attachments:	online_icq=32717734&img=21

Dear Adam Putnam,
  I met you with my husband at the Tampa VA Hospital.  
You may also remember me from the City Hall Meeting in Lakeland about the aeral spraying of the met fly.
 I love & look out for our Veterans & have seen far too much waiting & suffering on the part of the Veteran.
** My husband is a perfect example. He is 100% P&T from PTSD & 60% stomach Disorders due to Agent Orange exposure.
 He has been going to the Tampa VA for nealy 10 years. 99% of the time was because he had problems, bad ones with his stomach. The primary sends you to a specialist (that if your lucky) , you may see in 3 months.The specialist orders tests & see's you again, in say 3 months.Then you see the primary Dr. every 6 months to a years to find out results.
   I know because recently my husband has been seen on an emergency basis, given a prescriptions of anti-biotics & sent home, maybe 4 times in the past 3 months. April 3rd he sat 5 hours in Lakeland Emergency Room waiting to bee seen by a Dr. 
The Tampa VA was too far to drive with his pain. After being told he had a 2 to 4 hour more of a wait he left LRMC & headed for the Tampa VA, got as far as HWY 301 & went to Pasco Hospital in Dade City. It took 15 minutes before  Dr.Hashmi there saw him, ordered a shot & 1 test. One simple non- invasive test to find what the problem had been for years of tests  at the VA! 
He had 14 inches of his colon, small intestine & appendix removed. And there was a carcinoid tumor hiding in side the appendix. 
 
     I too just has surgery at the Tampa VA. After surgery I was put in a private room , waited 35 minutes for a nurse to respond while vomiting, in pain & it took the nurse an additional 45 minutes to return with a large blue bowl and a towel. She then left me soiled & exited the room. It was reported to the Head of Nurses but the point is there are too few caring Dr.'s & caring nurses, & far less life saving machines for testing & techs to properly do the testing. Mistakes are made I agree, but I think better care & concern  at the Tampa VA needs your looking into. Our Veterans have been there for us . "WE THE PEOPLE" are asking more service men to help now with terrioism, but if our goverment can't take care of these veterans, find & fix the problems of our men & women they will die. The outer grounds, ponds with fish & the plants , flowers & streams are beautiful, but I think more equiptment, more help is what our Veterans need most. I nearly lost my husband from being mis-diagonsised,wrong testing,& wrong medicine was given.It saddens my heart to see things like this happen . This is the USA.... Should we not come first ? Do our Veterans not deserve the very BEST for their sacrifices? I am cc: this letter to "Gov. Jeb Bush" as well as I know this needs to be addressed in every "Veterans Hospital". Thank you for your time & interest in this matter.
" GOD BLESS OUR VETERANS" & "GOD BLESS THE USA"  !!!!!!
        NANCY ANN WUESTHOFF
               2225 DEER RUN
          LAKELAND, FLORIDA
                   33809-1154
                 863-859-0009
ladyrose@tampabay.rr.com
website: www.geocities.com/yellow_rose30/WonderfulTribute.html
 
cc: ADAM PUTNAM & GOV. JEB BUSH

Nancy

From:	Moore, Tim <TimMoore@fdle.state.fl.us>
Sent:	Sunday, May 19, 2002 1:12 PM
To:	Jeb Bush
Cc:	Kathleen M. Shanahan (E-mail); Lauer, Stephen
Subject:	FW: Threat to Orlando Water Supply  (Not for Further Disclosure)

Governor.....as a follow up to my earlier email this morning.....here are
some additional facts.  (The specifics below are considered classified and
are not be disclosed )

At the end of the message below is a press release that will be put out this
afternoon around 3pm by our Regional Director Joyce Dawley and Sheriff Beary
in Orlando.  We decided to do this since we have had to deal with so many
individuals in putting the necessary precautions in place.  

Thanks......tim


>  -----Original Message-----
> From: 	Burke, John  
> Sent:	Sunday, May 19, 2002 1:04 PM
> To:	Moore, Tim; Dawley, Joyce; Newman, Lance
> Cc:	Ramer, Phil; OSI
> Subject:	Threat to Orlando Water Supply
> 
> At 2121 Hrs, May 18, 2002 the below message was posted on a Central
> Intelligence Agency (CIA) bulletin board operated out of the US Embassy in
> Paris, France:
> 
> we have posibly suspicion  for a terror charge on the drinking water
> system of ciry of orlando.
> if likes them more information than they will send us request here mails
> adress 
> (all spelling/grammar errors included)
> 
> A return e-mail address was included with the message indicating a Yahoo
> mail server located in France (pierrecardiff@yahoo.fr).  However, a review
> of the message and the posting information by FBI experts revealed that
> the posting was made over a dial-up modem connection from Germany. 
> 
> FBI Legal Attaches in Germany and France have requested local authorities
> to assist in identifying/locating both Pierre Cardiff and the Deutsche
> Telekon subscriber who appears to have actually "dialed up" and posted the
> message. Those efforts are ongoing.
> 
> The message has been reviewed by Behavioral Science Unit Profiler SA Tom
> Davis who opines that the message does not "contain an actual threat," and
> "appears to be an attempt to establish a dialogue."
> 
> All water treatment facilities and reservoirs in Region 5 have been
> notified and increased patrols/security are in place and will remain so
> for the next forty-eight (48) hours or until the leads are exhausted and
> the threat re-assessed
  

> .
> 
> Below please find a copy of the prepared text scheduled to released to the
> media in case of an inquiry:
> 
> Early this morning the FBI notified the Central Florida Regional Homeland
> Security Task Force of a vague, unsubstantiated threat to Orlando's water
> supply.
> 
> This morning members of the task force met to assess the information and
> implement the appropriate safety and security measure at all the city's
> and county's water purification and distribution facilities.
> 
> The information is currently being evaluated by the appropriate federal
> agencies. Local response to this information will be an immediate increase
> in security at all area water purification and distribution centers.
> 
> There is no evidence that our local water supply has been compromised. We
> stress that the information was vague and unsubstantiated and there is no
> threat to the public safety.
> 
> Citizens are asked to report any suspicious persons or activities around
> any public works facility to law enforcement by calling 9-1-1 immediately.

Re: Board 01400 Florida Corrections Commission. The positions up for 

appointment are; 001, 005, 006, 008, 009.



Dear Governor,

I am hesitant to bother you at this busy time in your career; however, 

here in Citrus County we have a true "Gem" that you should be aware of, 

and appoint to the Florida Corrections Commission. Dr. Schembri has 

lived in Citrus county for about three years, but he is by far the most 

qualified person probably in the entire State that you could appoint to 

the Florida Corrections Commission and I can assure you that if you do 

appoint him you will never regret it. I personally guarantee him and 

vouch for him in all respects. I have come to know Dr, Schembri very 

well, he is an outstanding individual and he has the the very strong 

endorsement of Nancy Argenziano, State Committeeman Ken Chadwick, State 

Committeewoman Debra Fredrick and my fellow Bush co-Chair Sam Lyons.



Listed below are some salient bullet points regarding Dr. Schembri:



 a.

. Former Correction Commissioner, New York City reduced violence 24% 

and overtime 33%.

 

b.. Former Police Commissioner Westchester New York, UN Representative 

International Association of Chiefs of              Police.

 

c.. On the cover of this months Official Newsletter of the Florida 

Department of Correction.

 

d.. Former Ethics Law Professor, Pace Law School.

 

e.. Former Dean, Criminal Justice Program, St. Francis College.

 

f.. Presently: Professor of Leadership, UCF Graduate Program, Orlando, 

Consultant US Department of Justice,                   Instructor, WTI 

Criminal Justice Academy, Correction & Police.

 

g.. Leadership Seminar Instructor Florida Dept. of Correction.

 

h.. Nominated for $100,000 Award for "Innovations In  Government" at Harvard

County Executive and City Manager.

onal Police Agency of 

Japan Toyko.

Re: Board 01400 Florida Corrections Commission. The positions up for 
appointment are; 001, 005, 006, 008, 009.

Dear Governor,
I am hesitant to bother you at this busy time in your career; however, 
here in Citrus County we have a true "Gem" that you should be aware of, 
and appoint to the Florida Corrections Commission. Dr. Schembri has 
lived in Citrus county for about three years, but he is by far the most 
qualified person probably in the entire State that you could appoint to 
the Florida Corrections Commission and I can assure you that if you do 
appoint him you will never regret it. I personally guarantee him and 
vouch for him in all respects. I have come to know Dr, Schembri very 
well, he is an outstanding individual and he has the the very strong 
endorsement of Nancy Argenziano, State Committeeman Ken Chadwick, State 
Committeewoman Debra Fredrick and my fellow Bush co-Chair Sam Lyons.

Listed below are some salient bullet points regarding Dr. Schembri:

 a.. Former Correction Commissioner, New York City reduced violence 24% 
and overtime 33%.
 
b.. Former Police Commissioner Westchester New York, UN Representative 
International Association of Chiefs of              Police.
 
c.. On the cover of this months Official Newsletter of the Florida 
Department of Correction.
 
d.. Former Ethics Law Professor, Pace Law School.
 
e.. Former Dean, Criminal Justice Program, St. Francis College.
 
f.. Presently: Professor of Leadership, UCF Graduate Program, Orlando, 
Consultant US Department of Justice,                   Instructor, WTI 
Criminal Justice Academy, Correction & Police.
 
g.. Leadership Seminar Instructor Florida Dept. of Correction.
 
h.. Nominated for $100,000 Award for "Innovations In  Government" at Harvard
 
i.. Appointed by two New York Mayors, Republican Governor of Vermont, 
County Executive and City Manager.
 
j.. U.S. Lifetime Achievement Award U.S. Marshall's.
 
k.. Fulbright  US Japan Foundation Evaluate National Police Agency of 
Japan Toyko.
 
l.. FBI National Academy Graduate.
 
m.. Graduate- School of Government -Harvard.

Very Respectfully submitted by your very strong supporter,

Commander Weston L. Stow, USN (Ret.)
Chairman, Chairman Caucus Republican Party of Florida

From: Arduindonna@aol.com [mailto:Arduindonna@aol.com]
Sent: Sunday, May 19, 2002 2:44 PM
To: Jeb Bush
Subject: implementing bill


We have not had a chance to talk about the bill--we provided a quick overview in the notebook we sent to you last friday.  I wanted to make sure you know that it contains about $30m in trust fund transfers, HR outsourcing language, CLEPing language that we requested, and language that puts us, the house and senate in charge of the redistricting certification process, and allows each of us to contract for legal services. 

Legal is still reviewing  the bill and may find issues, but we were able to remove/change much of the egregious language (the LG and Charles fixed the language on PSA's). The only item that remains that does not really modify an appropriation is the Hialeah language that allows the track to not pay taxes on handle for days it did not run. I am sure you know why I could not get this out of the bill!! 

I will speak to Charles, but you may want to ask him as well, if we need to sign the bill quickly because of the certification language...yes, I said sign :-)

>  -----Original Message-----
> From: 	Brantley, Michelle K.  
> Sent:	Sunday, May 19, 2002 6:08 PM
> To:	'cathybear143@aol.com'
> Cc:	Wilk, Gail
> Subject:	Family CAFE Question regarding Hyperbaric Oxygen Treatment
> 
> Dear Ms. Seacrist,
> 
> Thank you for your request for information concerning Medicaid coverage
> for hyperbaric oxygen treatment for individuals with cerebral palsy. I
> commend you for your tireless efforts on behalf of your son and other
> children with cerebral palsy in pursuing the services that they need.
> 
> Florida Medicaid reimburses for all medically necessary hyperbaric oxygen
> treatments with no limitations to eligible recipients under the age of 21.
> This service must be provided by enrolled Medicaid inpatient or outpatient
> hospitals that have appropriate hyperbaric chambers. If the geographical
> area where you reside does not have a hyperbaric chamber in the local
> hospital, a referral should be made to the closest facility. If
> transportation is needed, this may be coordinated through any one of our
> eleven Medicaid Area Offices throughout the state. 
> 
> According to the information you provided during the Family CAFE, you
> current reside at 3600 Arthur St., Hollywood, Florida 33021 and your phone
> number is 954-989-3394. I have forwarded this information to Gail Wilk in
> our Area 10 Office for assistance locating a provider in the Broward
> County. You may also contact your local Area Office directly at
> 954-202-3200.
> 
> We appreciate your advocacy on behalf of individuals with developmental
> disabilities and hope this information will assist you in obtaining the
> medical care your son needs. Please don't hesitate to contact me if I can
> be of any further assistance.
> 
> Sincerely,
> 
> Shelly Brantley
> Bureau Chief
> Health Systems Development
> Agency for Health Care Administration
>

Dear

I am writing to ask that Susan Dickerson by appointed as permanent Director
of Developmental Disabilities.  She is very competent and very caring.  She
knows our disability community, and she knows our Florida political
dynamics.  She is caring, responsive, and dialogical.

believe, set us back.

I am grateful for your commitment to persons with disabilities and their
families.  thank you for all you have done for us--

Dr. Rickey Cotton

-----Original Message-----
From: Jkreimer@aol.com [mailto:Jkreimer@aol.com]
Sent: Sunday, May 19, 2002 7:43 PM
To: Jeb Bush; jeb@myflorida.com
Subject: Apology and explanation


Dear Governor, My friends tell me that I have been a little hard on you - 
perhaps more critical than I should be in view of my not having explained 
fully why I think Gul Cumber would be a bad choice as a Commissioner on the 
North Broward Hospital Board.If you think so too, I apologize.
First of all, I believe that she falsified an important fact on her 
application, and I think that is grounds for being disqualified. I was told 
by someone who is, to me, an unimpeachable source, that she works for Jim 
Blosser. I am told that she said that she works for W.H Cumber and Company. 
That Company does not have a listing in the Fort Lauderdale, Miami, Pompano, 
or Deerfield Beach phone books. I had to get the number from a telephone 
supervisor after the regular information operator could not find it. In view 
of what our country has been subjected to lately, it bothered me a great deal.
Jim Blosser is part of a group in Broward County that includes Bill Scherer. 
They believe in absolute rule of the group, to the exclusion of anything that 
even resembles a democracy. Not too long ago, Blosser tried to prevent an 
80-year-old citizen by the name of Bob Koenig, from entering the County 
Commission chambers. He didn't want him to testify against the project that 
Blosser was supporting, and was very nasty about it. That is not the way our 
government is supposed to work.

As I have said before, I believe that nothing is more important to Bill 
Scherer than staying on as the attorney to the North Broward Hospital 
District. It is a multi-million dollar contract. I have explained to you how 
the Cambridge mess came to be - for the personal, political and financial 
gain of Bill Scherer. But it is out-and out fraud, theft of the public's 
money, theft of a doctor's equipment, instruments, his patients, in fact his 
life, and the source of enormous lack of respect for the Republican Party 
here as a result of it. They should be building you up, not tearing you down. 
By their actions, they are going back to the old Forman regime. (I am aware 
that the Formans were big supporters of you, but I believe that in the end, 
come next November, you will find that their support was a huge benefit to 
them, and a huge detriment to you.) As an example, I remember when a contract 
for a doctor by the name of Ivan Lavernia for eighty million dollrs to do all 
the indigent care in the District's bailiwick was being pushed by that group. 
He was no more qualified to do that than I am. Fortunately, the new Board 
(1993) stopped it.The expression "birds of a feather flock together" is 
flying around all over the place, and it isn't good for you or the Party in 
general.

Hamilton Forman has a personal dislike of Tim Bailey's father because he 
stopped Forman from continuing to do what Pat Bailey called "intimidating the 
Board" when
Pat Bailey sat on the Board as a Martinez appointee. I would appreciate it 
very much if you would prevent the plundering of the District by Forman and 
his clique, which includes Scherer, by appointing Tim Bailey. Sincerely, Jane 
Kreimer

I am willing to help you get it back if for no other reason than to help you with your upcoming campaign. Could you tell me how I would go about getting a copy of the cashed check (both sides) you sent her and a copy of the letter you sent demanding that she return the money?
 
If she cashed a check made out to "Crisis Pregnancy Center of Central Florida," she did it fraudulently because there is no such corporate name in Florida.
 
This is a wrong that needs to be corrected.
 

In His service,

-----Original Message-----
From: Hank Tester [mailto:chtest@bellsouth.net]
Sent: Sunday, May 19, 2002 10:52 PM
To: Jeb Bush
Subject: FULLER v. Republic of Cuba

















































Honorable Governer Bush:

I am a legal assistant at the law firm of John S. Gaebe & Associates, P.A. in Coconut Grove, Florida.

I would like for you and the Honorable President of the United States, George W. Bush to be made aware of a Wrongful death Complaint that was filed in the Circuit Court (Dade County) on Wednesday, 5/15/02 against the Republic of Cuba on behalf of Lynita Fuller Caskey, who is the surviving daugther of Bobby Fuller who was assasinated (by firing squad) by Fidel Castro's revolutionary (terrorist) government.

If there are any questions and/or additional information is needed, please contact our office at your convenience as follows:

LOURDES TESTER, 
Legal Assistant  for JOHN S. GAEBE

(305) 445-3800 office   (786) 683-0159 cell  or luly@florida-attorneys.com    

 

JSG:lt                                                                       IN THE CIRCUIT OF THE 11TH 

                                                                                JUDICIAL CIRCUIT IN AND FOR 

                                                                                MIAMI-DADE COUNTY, FLORIDA

                                                                                GENERAL JURISDICTION 

DIVISIONLYNITA FULLER CASKEY, as          

Personal Representative of the

Estate of ROBERT OTIS FULLER,

Deceased, on behalf of Lynita Fuller

Caskey, surviving daughter, and The

Estate of Robert Otis Fuller,

Plaintiff, 

vs.



THE REPUBLIC OF CUBA,

Defendant.

___________________________/

C O M P LA I N T

Plaintiff, LYNITA FULLER CASKEY, as Personal Representative of the Estate of ROBERT OTIS FULLER, ("BOBBY FULLER" ) Deceased, on behalf of Lynita Fuller Caskey, surviving daughter, and The Estate of Robert Otis Fuller, through undersigned counsel, hereby sues the Defendant, THE REPUBLIC OF CUBA ("CUBA") and alleges as follows:

1. This is an action for damages in excess of the minimum jurisdictional limits of this Court.

2. Plaintiff, LYNITA FULLER CASKEY is, and at all times material hereto was a national of the United States of America and a resident of South Florida.

3. Defendant, CUBA is, and at all times material hereto was, a foreign sovereign state as defined by the terms and provisions of 28 U.S.C. § 1603.

4. At all times material hereto, Plaintiff LYNITA FULLER CASKEY, was, is and/or will 

be duly appointed Personal Representative of the Estate of ROBERT OTIS FULLER, Deceased, and the proper party to bring this action.

5. This court has jurisdiction over the subject matter of this cause pursuant to the terms of 28 U.S.C. §§ 1330 and 1331 as Plaintiff’s claims are brought pursuant to the Foreign Sovereign Immunities Act, 28 U.S.C. § 1602, et seq. 

6. Defendant CUBA is subject to suit in a court of competent jurisdiction in any state court in the United States pursuant to the provisions of 28 U.S.C. § 1605.

7. Congress has crafted an exception to the Foreign Sovereign Immunities Act, through the Anti-Terrorism and Effective Death Penalty Act of 1996 ("AEDPA"). Under 28 U.S.C. § 1605(7), the sovereign immunity of a foreign state is waived when a U.S. national Plaintiff seeks money damages in United States courts for acts of extrajudicial killing for which the foreign state is responsible.

8. The substantive cause of action is based upon the Civil Liability for Acts of State Sponsored Terrorism, 28 U.S.C.A. § 1605. Said statute creates a cause of action against agents of a foreign state that act under the conditions specified in section 1605(a)(7) of the Foreign Sovereign Immunities Act.

9. An additional substantive claim lies in the Torture Victim Protection Act of 1991. Said Act establishes a civil action for recovery of damages from an individual who, under actual or apparent authority of a foreign nation, engages in torture or extrajudicial killing.

10. A foreign nation is liable for damages to the individual’s legal representative, or to any person who may be a claimant in an action for wrongful death. For purposes of this Act, the term "extrajudicial killing" means a deliberate killing not authorized by a previous judgment pronounced by a regularly constituted court affording all the judicial guarantees

which are recognized as indispensable by civilized peoples. See 28 U.S.C. § 1605(e)(1).

11. Summary executions are considered "extrajudicial killing" within the meaning of 28 U.S.C. § 1350. See Lafontant v. Aristide, 844 F.Supp. 128 (E.D.N.Y. 1994) (dicta).

12. Defendant, CUBA is designated to be a state sponsor of terrorism under the terms and provisions of 56(j) of Export Administration Act of 1979, 50 U.S.C. § 2405(j).

FACTS OF THE CASE

13. In 1903, Jennie M. Fuller, (paternal grandmother of Plaintiff), moved to Holguin, Cuba with her family from Massachusetts. Her father, Alvin Jewett purchased and developed certain land and held other assets and personal properties in Holguin, Cuba including but not limited to:

	Plantation at Holguin, Cuba consisting of approximately 120 caballerias 

of land and improvements thereof--(approximately 4,000 acres of land)

A saw mill, equipment, livestock (cattle) crops, 

A sugar cane business and other personal property

The family owned and operated a saw mill, they raised crops, cattle and grew sugar cane 

on the island.

14. Jennie M. (Jewett) Fuller, (paternal grandmother of Plaintiff), married William Otis Fuller in 1925, (both United States citizens) and had seven children, including the Plaintiff’s father, Robert Otis Fuller all of which were born in Cuba. Bobby Fuller was born on May 11, 1934 in Santiago de Cuba

15. The Fuller family assets and properties located in Holguin, Cuba were jointly owned by Plaintiff’s paternal grandparents, Jennie M. Fuller and William Otis Fuller, her husband, and by Plaintiff’s paternal uncle, Miles Chester Jewett.

16. On July 21, 1940, the family formed a corporation called Cia. Agricola De Lewiston, S.A., a Cuban Corporation. All assets were assigned to Cia. Agricola De Lewiston, S.A., which was created for the specific purpose of carrying on and/or conducting the family business in Cuba. The Cuban Corporation conducted business in Cuba continuously from July 21, 1940 until August of 1959.

17. In January of 1959, Fidel Castro and his 26th of July Communist revolutionary rebel army movement took power over Cuba and began to radically alter the economy and social structure of the island. 

18. By May of 1959 the Castro government restricted or set forth the maximum limits of land ownerships allowed for individuals and corporate entities. All additional or excess (privately owned) land was expropriated or confiscated by the government. Shortly thereafter, all lands were nationalized and became "state owned" properties.

19. In August of 1959, the Castro Government ordered that the Fuller family corporation be dissolved.

20. By September 3, 1959, the family corporation, Cia Agricola De Lewiston, S.A. was formally dissolved pursuant to orders of the Castro government at which time the family distributed the corporate assets among its stockholders as follows:

Mr. & Mrs. William Otis Fuller 68.994 caballerias of land/ 2,287.97 acres

Mr. & Mrs. Miles Chester Jewett 58.730 caballerias of land/ 1,947.60 acres

(1 caballeria equals 33.162 acres)

21. By December of 1959, the Cuban Communist Revolution was in full force and the survival of existing businesses and institutions were threatened. Due to the foregoing, the late William Otis Fuller returned to the U.S. while Jennie M. Fuller, his wife remained in Cuba to look over and protect the Fuller family land and their assets.

22. As of February of 1960, the Fuller’s land, property, and saw mill including all of it’s improvements, livestock, personal belongings and other items of personal value situated on the property, were intervened, and/or confiscated by the Castro Government.

23. Subsequently thereafter, the Plaintiff’s father, Bobby Fuller, ventured to Cuba in an effort to protect his family’s land, businesses and other interests.

24. On October 15, 1960, Bobby Fuller (ex-U.S. Marine) along with another American and two Cuban nationals, were captured and arrested by Castro agents who charged them with counter-revolutionary activities. By 4:00 P.M. on the same day, Bobby Fuller and the three others were placed in a sham trial held in Santiago De Cuba. They were all convicted within a few hours followed by an immediate appeal which took less than fifteen minutes. Sentences were instantaneously imposed and upheld as follows:

	The two Cuban Nationals were sentenced to imprisonment.

	The two Americans were sentenced to death by firing squad.



25. By 4:20 A.M.- October 16, 1960, less than twenty four hours after his capture and arrest, agents of the Castro Government in San Juan Hill, acting under orders of the Castro Government, led Bobby Fuller to a firing squad where he was shot and killed after being tortured by having his blood drained from his body. Thereafter, his body was thrown into an unmarked mass grave in an unknown location.

COUNT I - WRONGFUL DEATH

26. Plaintiff re-alleges and reasserts paragraphs 1 through 26 as if fully set forth herein.

27. On October 16, 1960, Defendant, CUBA intentionally, unlawfully, and with complete disregard for human life, tortured and executed ROBERT OTIS FULLER.

28. Defendant, CUBA caused the deliberate and wrongful death of ROBERT OTIS FULLER by directing and participating in the torture and execution of the deceased.

29. As a direct and proximate result of the Defendant’s actions, Lynita Fuller Caskey, as surviving daughter and the Estate of Robert Otis fuller have suffered the following damages:

a. Lynita Fuller Caskey, as surviving daughter, has lost the support and services of the Decedent, Robert Otis Fuller in the past with interest and will continue to suffer such losses in the future, and;

b. Lynita Fuller Caskey, as surviving daughter, has suffered the loss of her father’s love, companionship and protection in the past and will continue to suffer such loss in the future.

c. Lynita Fuller Caskey, as surviving daughter, has suffered severe mental pain and anguish in the past and will continue to do so in the future.

d. The Estate of Robert Otis Fuller lost net accumulations and sustained economic losses, and;

e. The Estate of Robert Otis Fuller also seeks compensation for the pain and suffering of Robert Otis Fuller prior to his death.

f. Any and all other damages to which Plaintiff may be entitled.

WHEREFORE, Plaintiff, LYNITA FULLER CASKEY demands judgment against THE REPUBLIC OF CUBA for compensatory damages, plus interest and costs.

COUNT II - PUNITIVE DAMAGES

30. Plaintiff realleges and reasserts paragraph 1 through 26 as if fully set forth herein.

31. The extreme and outrageous acts of CUBA, the Defendant, in intentionally torturing and executing the deceased, ROBERT OTIS FULLER constitute willful and/or wanton 

acts.

32. Pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1606, Plaintiff, LYNITA FULLER CASKEY is entitled to recover punitive damages from Defendant, CUBA for this extreme and outrageous conduct.

WHEREFORE, Plaintiff demands judgment against THE REPUBLIC OF CUBA for punitive damages.

	JOHN S. GAEBE & ASSOCIATES, P.A. RASCO, REININGER, PEREZ

Counsel for Plaintiff & ESQUENAZI, P.L.

	2950 S.W. 27th Avenue Counsel for Plaintiff 

	Miami, FL 33133 283 Catalonia Avenue, 2nd Floor

	Phone (305) 445-3800 Coral Gables, FL 33134

	Fax (305) 448-5800 Phone (305) 476-7100

Fax (305) 476-7102

I AM BEGGING YOU TO TAKE ACTION TO GET THIS DISTRICTS DCF DD PROGRAM TO SETTLE THIS ISSUE.   EVERY TIME I HEAR FROM THEM,  THEY CHANGE THEIR STORY AS TO ADAMS CASE.   NOTHING WILL PROCEED FOR ADAM UNTIL THIS IS SETTLED AND THEY REFUSE TO GIVE MONIES BACK TO ME THAT ARE DUE ME BY A VOTE OF OUR FAMILY CARE COUNCIL (FCC).
 
FOR SEVERAL YEARS NOW THE DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES  (DD) PROGRAM (ERIC OLSEN) HAS FOUGHT BACK AND FORTH WITH ME ABOUT $1631. THAT BACK IN 1999 ADAMS CASE WORKER SENT TO ME BECAUSE I WAS ON ABC VOUCHERING.  THE MONEY WAS SENT TO GO TOWARD MAKING ADAMS BATHROOM WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE. (COST WILL BE $5000.00 OR MORE TOTAL)   THE DISTRICT WAS REQUIRED TO OBTAIN MORE THAN ONE BID AND WHEN I GAVE THAT PAPERWORK FROM A MAN WHO WORKED AT HOME DEPOT  TO LINDA COLKITT, ADAMS CASE WORKER AT THE TIME,  I TOLD HER TO JUST HOLD ON TO IT BECAUSE THE MAN WAS GOING TO USE HIS 13 YR. OLD SON TO HELP HIM AND I WANTED TO CHECK TO SEE IF THIS MAN HAD A CONTRACTORS LICENSE.  TEN DAYS LATER A CHECK FOR THE $1631. ARRIVED JUST AS ALL MY OTHER ABC VOUCHER MONIES HAD ARRIVED.  
 
IN A MEETING TO SIGN ADAM ONTO MED WAIVER IN MAY. 2000, WITH MARK YOUNG , THE DISTRICT 14 DD PROGRAM MANAGER (WHO WAS ACTING AS ADAMS SUPPORT COORDINATOR (SC) AT THE TIME.... HE QUIT DCF DD IN DECEMBER 2001) I REMINDED MARK THAT I HAD TO PAY VIA CREDIT CARD THAT $1631. TOWARD THE TOTAL COST WHEN THE BATHROOM WAS REMODELED.   WHEN ADAM GOT ROBIN NASON AS A SC IN  OCT. 2000 AND SHE CAME TO UPDATE ADAMS HAB PLAN,   I AGAIN REMINDED HER THAT I WOULD NEED TO PAY $1631.  TOWARD THE  BATHROOM WHEN THE DISTRICT ACTUALLY DID THE REMODELING.  I REPEATEDLY BEGGED ERIC TO SETTLE THIS MATTER BY LETTING ME PAY THE MONEY WHEN THE WORK WAS DONE AS I HAVE NO WAY TO GET $1631. CASH TO HAND TO THE DISTRICT.  HE HAS REFUSED AND AT A MEETING AT THE DISTRICT OFFICE ON MARCH 29, 2001, IN WHICH ROBIN NASON WAS FIRED FOR INCOMPETENCE,  LINDA BROPHY STATED TO ME,   "ALL OF ADAMS SERVICES WILL HAVE TO BE DISCONTINUED UNTIL YOU PAY US BACK THE MONEY"  NO MATTER HOW MANY TIMES I CALLED GARRETTS,  THE MEDICAL SUPPLY STORE (FROM MARCH 2001 UNTIL APRIL 2002 ...EXCEPT FOR JAN. 2002 WHEN MARK HAD QUIT AND SOMEONE APPROVED ONE MONTH) THAT WAS CONTRACTED TO SEND ADAMS SUPPLIES, APPROVAL WAS NEVER GRANTED. NOTHING ON ADAMS  HAB PLAN OR APPROVED ON HIS COST PLAN WAS IMPLEMENTED DURING THAT TIME.  LINDA BROPHY TOLD ME TO SEND RECEIPTS FOR THE MONEY AND I DID. IN A LETTER DEC. 2001, MARK YOUNG TOLD ME THE RECEIPTS WERE "UNACCEPTABLE'.  ERIC TOLD ME TO "SEND RECEIPTS FOR WORK DONE" SO I CALLED, FRANK MURILLO OF PRO-TEX CONTRACTING,  THE CONTRACTOR THAT ROBIN NASON HAD HAD COME OUT AND SUBMIT A BID IN MAY OF 2000.  HE CAME HERE ON APRIL 3, 2002 AND THE FOLLOWING OCCURRED:
 
    1.  THAT WEDNESDAY, HE AND 2 EMPLOYEES LOOKED AT THE BATHROOM & ASK  ME WHAT NEEDED TO BE DONE AND I TOLD HIM AND TOLD HIM I ONLY HAD $1631. TO DO THE  WORK ( A DOORWAY FROM ADAMS ROOM TO THE BATHROOM, A SINK WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE AND AN EXHAUST FAN) AND I ASK FRANK WOULD THAT BE ENOUGH AND HE STATED"FOR YOU I WILL DO IT FOR THAT".
 
    2.  HE HAD ME MEET HIM AT HOME DEPOT AND HE FILLED A CART WITH SUPPLIES.  I TOLD HIM AT THE STORE THAT THE SINK HE BOUGHT WAS WRONG AND THAT THE DOOR HE WANTED ME TO PURCHASE WOULD NOT WORK.  HE MADE ME BUY IT ANYWAY. (THE DOOR,  SINK, FACET, AND EXHAUST FAN HAD TO BE TAKEN BACK BY ME THE NEXT DAY AND EXCHANGED .... WHICH COST ME $90.00 MORE.) THE SUPPLIES THAT DAY WERE CHARGED TO MY CREDIT CARD.  FRANK MURILLO LEFT ME THERE IN LINE TO PAY.
 
   3.  APRIL 3RD,  FRANK MET ME BACK AT MY HOME AND I GAVE HIM THE PAPERWORK FROM HOME DEPOT FOR THE SUPPLIES AND HE LOOKED AT THE PAPERWORK AND ON THE INSIDE OF HIS FOLDER,  DID THE MATH TO TAKE THAT AMOUNT OFF OF THE $1631. WHICH LEFT $1307. WHICH FRANK PROCEEDED TO TELL ME THAT HE REQUIRED AT LEAST 1/2 OF THE TOTAL THAT DAY AS A DEPOSIT.  HE TOOK MY CREDIT CARD AND CALLED HIS OFFICE AND CHARGED THE $1307. TO MY CREDIT CARD.  I TOLD HIM I WOULD TRUST HIM SINCE HE WAS PAID IN FULL INSTEAD OF JUST 1/2 AS A DEPOSIT. 
 
  4.  HIS EMPLOYEE SHOWED UP AT MY HOME THE NEXT DAY, THURSDAY, REEKING OF BOOZE AND I CALLED FRANK RIGHT AWAY.  AN HOUR LATER,  FRANK CAME AND TOLD ME "IF YOU WANT ANY WORK DONE, THEN THIS MAN IS THE ONLY ONE WHO CAN WORK TODAY OR YOU GET NO WORK DONE". HE TOLD ME THAT THE EMPLOYEE, MIKE, HAD TOLD HIM THAT HE HAD BEEN TO A PARTY AND DRINKING UNTIL 3:00 AM BUT HAD NOT BEEN DRINKING THAT MORNING.  I HAVE ENOUGH EXPERIENCE TO SAY THAT THIS MAN APPEARED TO BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE AN I TOLD FRANK THAT I DID NOT WANT MIKE TO RUN ELECTRICAL WIRING IN MY HOME THAT DAY.  FRANK TOLD MIKE NOT TO DO ANY ELECTRICAL WORK AND TOLD ME THAT CLAY WOULD COME AND DO THE ELECTRICAL WIRING THE NEXT DAY.  WHEN CLAY WAS NOT HERE BY 10:00AM,  I CALLED FRANK AND HE INFORMED ME THAT NO ONE COULD COME THAT DAY WHICH WOULD LEAVE NO AVAILABLE SINK ALL WEEKEND FOR THE BOYS.  I REMINDED FRANK THAT MIKE HAD NOT DONE MUCH WORK THURSDAY AND HE TOLD ME THAT I SHOULD HAVE NEVER HAVE LET MIKE IN THAT THURSDAY AND IT WAS MY FAULT.  HE THEN TOLD ME AGAIN NO ONE COULD COME THAT DAY.   HE TOLD ME TO GET SOME ONE ELSE TO FINISH THE JOB.  I TOLD HIM THAT HIS MAN HAD CUT THE DOORWAY 38 1/2" INSTEAD OF 36" AND THAT HIS MEN WOULD HAVE TO FIX THE MESS.  FRANKS MAN PUT 2X4S UNDER THE SINK TO HOLD IT UP AND I COMPLAINED SO THERON MADE SOME CABINETS WHICH WERE HORRIBLE (SIZE REQUIRED THAT THE SINK JUST SAT ON  THE SIDES OF THE  CABINET,  THE SINK COULD NOT BE CENTERED, AND THE COLOR WAS NOT AT ALL COMPATIBLE TO ANY WOOD IN OUR HOME MUCH LESS THE WOOD MIRROR CABINET ABOVE THE  SINK.   ON MAY 1ST, FRANK FINALLY HAD THERON JUST PURCHASE THE SINK STAND THAT I HAD TOLD FRANK AT HOME DEPOT ON APRIL 3RD, THAT I WANTED AND HE HAD REFUSED.  I KNOW NOW THAT FRANK BOUGHT JUST THE MINIMUM SUPPLIES AND CHEAPEST SUPPLIES IN  ORDER TO INCREASE THE LABOR MONEY HE WOULD GET.
 
  4.  MAY 2, 2002  HIS MAN, THERON, FINISHED INSTALLING THE STAND AND SINK AND LEFT STATING THAT HE WAS FINISHED AND NOT GOING TO RETURN.   
 
THE WORK IS AWFUL.   ANOTHER CONTRACTOR IS  TO BE HERE  TOMORROW MORNING CONTACTED BY ADAMS NEW SC  TO FINISH TO MAKE THE BATHROOM WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE .....   (I AM GOING TO CALL AND CANCEL THIS APPOINTMENT AS I WILL NOT LEAVE ADAM ALONE AT THE HOSPITAL AGAIN WHEN IT IS OBVIOUS TO ME THAT THIS DISTRICT DD DOES NOT INTEND TO SETTLE THE MATTER OF THE $1631. NO MATTER WHAT I DO AND DO NOT INTEND TO  PAY FOR WORK TO PROCEED TO FIX THIS BATHROOM AND PUT IN A ROLL IN SHOWER FOR ADAM TO BE INDEPENDENT NOR INTEND TO REIMBURSE ME THE MONIES FROM THE FND CONFERENCE)..... THIS NEW CONTRACTOR TOLD ME HE HAS PICTURES OF FRANKS PRIOR JOBS THAT  HE USES FOR STATE WORKSHOPS THAT SHOW WHAT CAN HAPPEN WHEN YOU USE THE WRONG CONTRACTOR. HE TOLD ME TO NOT TOUCH ANYTHING AND HE WILL TAKE OF GETTING THE BATHROOM DONE RIGHT FOR ADAM TO USE. DD IS SUPPOSE TO COVER THE COST OF THIS.
 
  5.  FRANK MURILLO WENT UP IN FRONT OF THE CONTRACTOR LICENSING BOARD ON MAY 9TH.  HE DID NOT COME BUT HIS LAWYER GOT THE CHARGES DROPPED BECAUSE THE MAN WHO FILED THE CHARGES TOLD ME THAT FRANK PAID HIM OFF WITH $3000.00.  FRANK MURILLO  HAS HAD HIS CONTRACTORS LICENSE TAKEN FROM HIM BEFORE THIS AND NO ONE SEEMS TO KNOW HOW HE GOT ANOTHER LICENSE  TO MAKE MONEY (HIS LICENSE IS UNDER HIS SONS NAME AS I UNDERSTAND IT NOW).... ANYWAY, I TELL YOU ALL THIS TO MAKE YOU UNDERSTAND HOW THIS DISTRICT 14 DEPARTMENT OF CHILDREN AND FAMILIES (DCF) DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES PROGRAM TREATS THEIR CLIENTS AND THE FAMILIES WHO LOVE THEM AND CARE FOR THEM...... THIS MAN NOW HAS TOLD DD LIES BY STATING THAT HE NEVER SAW THE PAPERWORK FROM HOME DEPOT TO DEDUCT THE COST OF  SUPPLIES FROM THE $1631. TO GET THE $1307. THAT HE CHARGED ON MY CARD AND HE STATES THAT HE RETURNED $200.00 TO ME WHICH HE DID NOT AND NOW THE DCF DD PROGRAM ON TOP OF THE $1700. I HAVE ALREADY INCURRED ON MY CREDIT CARD FOR THIS WORK, DEMANDS THAT I GIVE THEM $200.00...... WHY WOULD DISTRICT 14 DD PEOPLE CALL ME A LIAR BECAUSE I WROTE BACK TO BRENDA BRYAN WHEN SHE WROTE TO ASK  THE DETAILS AND I EXPLAINED TO HER EXACTLY WHAT I HAVE TOLD YOU.... THE TRUTH ON MY LIFE AND THE LIVES OF MY SONS......... FRANK TOOK THE PAPERWORK AND CONFIRMED THE COST OF SUPPLIES  AND DEDUCTED THAT COST FROM THE $1631. TO GET THE $1307. LABOR COSTS.... I EVEN SENT A LETTER TO FRANK DETAILING THE EVENTS AND STATED IN THE LETTER THAT HE WAS TO SEND ME WRITTEN DOCUMENTATION IF HE DID NOT CONCUR WITH THE EVENTS AS I STATED.  I NEVER HEARD FROM HIM AND EVEN THOUGH I SENT A COPY OF THIS LETTER TO BRENDA BRYAN,  THAT IS NOT ENOUGH TO END THIS NIGHTMARE.   I FAXED BRENDA FROM THE HOSPITAL THAT THEY CAN TELL FRANK TO SEND THE $200. DIRECTLY TO THEM AT DD AS I DO NOT W NT HIS MONEY NOW....... I AM FORCED TO FILE SEPARATE COMPLAINT PAPERWORK TO TAKE THIS MAN IN FRONT OF THE BOARD AGAIN  AND TAKE TIME TO GO BACK IN FRONT OF THE BOARD AGAIN  MYSELF...... MORE TIME I CERTAINLY DO NOT HAVE.
 
MY QUESTION TO YOU IS THIS......WHAT WILL YOU DO?  I HAVE BEEN LIVING ON MY LAND IN POLK COUNTY SINCE FEB. 99.   EXCEPT FOR DIAPERS AND SOME OTHER MEDICAL SUPPLIES (WHICH HAVE NOW ALL BEEN DENIED) ADAM, AS A DD CLIENTS IN THIS DISTRICT HAS GOT NOTHING SINCE FEB. 99.  SINCE COMING TO POLK COUNTY, I HAVE HAD IN HOME RESPITE CARE ON ALL 4  OF ADAMS ANNUAL HAB PLANS AND HAVE NOT RECEIVED ONE DAY.  ALL I HAVE BEEN   OFFERED IS TO TAKE ADAM TO SOME FOSTER HOME BUT SINCE ADAM MUST CATHERIZE FOR RESIDUAL URINE EVERY 4 HOURS,  I WILL NOT TAKE HIM INTO AN UNKNOWN ENVIRONMENT TO HAVE SOMEONE NOT QUALIFIED CATHERIZE HIM ON SOME COMMUNITY TOILET.  IT SEEMS TO ME ACCORDING TO WHAT I HAVE HAD TO ENDURE IN THIS DISTRICT SINCE FEB. 99,  THAT THIS DISTRICT HAS ONE THING IN MIND AND THAT IS HOW THE DISTRICT CAN DENY SERVICES AND SPEND THE LEAST AMOUNT OF MONEY, IF ANY, FOR A CLIENT.   DELMARVA IS NOW IN ITS SECOND YEAR OF THE NOW 4 YEAR CONTRACT OF 3.9 MILLION/YEAR TO MAKE CONDITIONS BETTER FOR THE POPULATION OF PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES IN THE STATE OF FLORIDA, BUT AS OF YET THEY HAVE NOT DONE ONE THING TO MAKE ANYTHING BETTER FOR ADAM.  I CAN NOT EVEN GET MINUTES OF THE LAVISH, LUXURY MEETINGS THAT THESE PEOPLE KEEP HAVING AROUND THE STATE "TO MAKE DD SERVICES BETTER" .  ANOTHER INSTANCE (DELMARVAS 3.9 MILLION/YEAR AND THE PEOPLE OF THE IQC) OF A LOT OF PEOPLE MAKING BIG BUCKS IN SALARIES AND A LOT OF THEIR TRAVELING ALL OVER THE COUNTRY PAID FOR BY THE STATE OF FLORIDA.................. BUT NOTHING DONE FOR THE PEOPLE THEY ARE HIRED TO SERVE.
 
IT IS NOW 12:45 AM ON MONDAY... I HAVE SPENT VALUABLE TIME AWAY FROM ADAM WHO IS LYING IN A HOSPITAL BED RIDDLED WITH FEVER TO COME HOME AND REACH OUT TO YOU FOR HELP........................ PLEASE LET ME HEAR FROM YOU.................... PLEASE .
 
CYNDI GRATE
EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR
CAREGIVERS ORGANIZED FOR PHYSICALLY IMPAIRED STUDENTS (COPIS)
DISTRICT 14 FAMILY CARE COUNCIL MEMBER

From:	Kemmer, Laverne <Laverne.Kemmer@MyFlorida.com>
Sent:	Monday, May 20, 2002 8:12 AM
To:	Jeb Bush
Subject:	FW: Weekly Report 



> On behalf of Celeste, who is on leave today..............
> 
> 
> We received 5,104 e-mails and 1,488 letters this week.  
> 
> Hot topics:
> 
> The Governor received about 27 e-mails, a few letters, and some phone
> calls about the federal visa length proposal.  Many from Canada, Germany
> and UK are concerned about how this will impact their annual winters in
> Florida.
> 
> About 6 e-mails came in about veterans who are disabled having to forfeit
> portions of their military retirement benefits in order to qualify for
> military disability benefits.  I understand the Washington office is
> conferring with Kathleen Shanahan and Pam Dana (maybe others) about what
> response should be made.
> 
> We continued to receive a few e-mails and letters concerning Middle East
> matters.  Most call for peace in the area, and some are offering
> suggestions for military strategy.
> 
> We received correspondence from citizens angry about rising insurance
> policy premiums in every category imaginable, homeowners, automobile,
> health insurance, medical malpractice, etc.  Primary concerns were
> regarding the dramatic size of the increases and the state's approval of
> such increases.  Many e-mails and letters are coming from professionals,
> including insurance agents, physicians, and small business owners.  We
> did, however, receive several thank-you e-mails responses from citizens
> following the signing of SB 1418.  These were in response to a blast
> e-mail we sent out.
> 
> We received a high volume of calls and mail (most were from organized
> campaign) about SB 813, opposing the amendment by Jim King.  A blast
> e-mail explaining the Governor's reasons for signing went out this
> morning.
> 
> A moderate volume of calls to cut the funding for the Learning Gateway
> portion of SB 1844 came in. Callers said it invades family privacy for new
> parents and is a waste of the taxpayer's money.
> 
> Many callers supported Line Item 2484-A, funding for the Jupiter Theatre
> in Palm Beach County.
> 
> A few callers want the Governor to veto SB 160 because they are opposed to
> increasing gambling and fear that it will cause harm to the greyhounds.  A
> few callers say "the publicity against greyhound racing is overblown."
> 
> There was a small number of calls for new leadership at Department of
> Children and Families.
> 
> Many cards were received thanking the Governor for not allowing Rosie
> O'Donnell's media campaign to influence him.  A few called to say thanks
> for not supporting gay adoptions.  
> 
> Some called to say thanks for signing SB-108.
> 
> A medium number of calls came in support of Tax-free Week, and a few
> called about the 2.5% pay raise for state employees.  One single mother
> said her pay is actually going backwards due to a 13% increase in
> insurance costs and only a 2.5% raise.
> 
> There were several letter-writing campaigns, including calls to delay the
> Florida Retirement System Investment Plan, opposing construction of Spring
> Haven Apartments in Spring Hill/Hernando County, opposing SFWMD and DEP
> pumping billions of gallons of polluted stormwater into the Everglades,
> saying SFWMD is not properly preserving Loxahatchee River, and regarding
> Medicare cuts proposed in the 2003 Federal Budget.
> 
> And so went another week in the Office of Citizens' Services.
> 
> Have a great weekend!     
> 
> 
> 
From:	Jimenez, Frank <Frank.Jimenez@MyFlorida.com>
Sent:	Monday, May 20, 2002 8:37 AM
To:	Jeb Bush; Shanahan, Kathleen; Muniz, Katie; Arduin, Donna; Turbeville, Greg
Subject:	FW: UC Claims Increase
Attachments:	UC Weekly Claims Report.ppt; May 2002 Actual and Estimated Regular UC.ppt; claims by industry5-17-02.xls



>  -----Original Message-----
> From: 	Hadi, Lucy D.  
> Sent:	Friday, May 17, 2002 4:32 PM
> To:	Austin, Curtis; McGurk, Thomas D.
> Cc:	Jimenez, Frank
> Subject:	UC Claims Increase
> 
> Beginning with the 2nd week in April, we have seen a dramatic increase in
> initial claims for regular UC benefits.  We fully expected a significant
> increase in claims associated with the Temporary Extended UC (TEUC)
> benefit program initiated in mid-March, and that has materialized.
> However, as you can see from the charts included in the weekly UC claims
> report (see attached), initial claims were 73.4% higher in April 2002 than
> in April 2001.  Also, claims for April 2002 slightly exceeded claims for
> October 2001, and October was the highest number of claims ever processed.
> We paid out $106.3 million in regular UC claims for the month of April.  
> 
> Unfortunately, the trend of increased UC claims workload has continued in
> May.  As shown in the separate chart for May, we received 44,410 claims
> through COB yesterday.  A projection of the average daily claims rate for
> May suggests that we could receive 85,000 claims by the end of the
> month-6% higher than our highest month.  Of further concern is that,
> historically, July is the highest claims month of the year, and we are
> already much above any rate we could have reasonably anticipated.
> 
> A staff team drawn from both UC and Labor Market Information has been
> working for nearly two weeks to identify factors that could be
> contributing to the increase in initial regular UC claims.  Here is a
> summary of their findings:
> 
> -	April was the beginning of a new calendar quarter, and there is
> always an increase in claims volume with the new quarter.  Historic
> caseload charts bear this out.
> -	Easter was early this year, so seasonal farmworker layoffs began
> earlier and may be larger due to both weather and economic factors.
> -	The UC program, as required by USDOL, sent letters to all
> individuals who were potentially eligible for the TEUC program-344,000
> letters were sent out in total with the last batch being mailed during the
> second week in April.
> -	Florida has experienced negative job growth, i.e., actual job loss,
> for at least two months.  
> -	UC claims increased markedly over 2001 in construction,
> transportation, communications, finance, insurance, health, education, and
> management services (see attached table).  This suggests lack of strength
> in key sectors of Florida's economy.
> 
> This increase in UC claims workload could be partially "self-inflicted" as
> a result of the TEUC letters.  However, the workload is real and will
> impact not only UC claims, adjudication and appeals services but will
> significantly increase traffic in one-stop centers.  We will continue to
> monitor developments daily and will advise you immediately should we need
> to seek additional budget authority for benefit payments, UC
> administration, or one-stop operations.
> 
>  <<UC Weekly Claims Report.ppt>>  <<May 2002 Actual and Estimated Regular
> UC.ppt>>  <<claims by industry5-17-02.xls>> 
> 
> 
> Lucy Hadi, Deputy Director
> Agency for Workforce Innovation
>

-----Original Message-----
From: Ira Baum DPM [mailto:ibaum@cofs.net]
Sent: Sunday, May 19, 2002 2:37 PM
To: Jeb Bush
Subject: Deering


Jeb,
 
Thanks for taking a moment to speak with me on Sunday.  My name is Ira Baum.
The purpose of this note is request your guidance to fund a project that I am working with in conjuction with Florida International Universiy department of Engineering.
The goal of the project is:
1.    To improve the health care of Floridians and potentially all Americans.
2.    Fund a major university in Florida's R&D department.
 
Background:
 
I am a practicing podiatrist in Miami for over twenty years.  During that time it became apparent that the greatest percentage of foot problems that afflict the population that I cared for, was due to diseases such as diabetes and poor foot mechanics .  It is well known that  custom foot supports, or "foot orthotics" have the potential to prevent and reduce the risks of developing foot illnesses, and assist in healing foot wounds of diabetics that can lead to prolonged disability and amputation.   
Custom foot supports are nothing new, however the cost and the time involved to purchase the foot supports is and remains prohibitive to most Floridians and Americans.  During the last 10 years I have developed a proprietary approach a "System and Method to Manufacture Custom Foot Supports".  
Basically the system consists of a scanner to scan the bottom surface of the foot, analysis software that will modify the scan and output unique tool path patterns to a CNC milling machine to manufacture a custom foot support for the individual.  The goal of the project is to bring to the public a cost effective, and rapidly produced foot insert.  The foot insert will help prevent foot problems, and improve comfort and function of the foot, reducing disabilities that lead to the increased cost of healthcare, and labor.
 
Need:
 
I have personally funded the early phases of the project.  At the last meeting with Professors Chin - Sheng Chin, Ph.D and Kinzy Jones, Ph.D, it was decided to explore additional sources of funding for the project.  Presently we are seeking a department or agency of the State of Florida  that can fund Phase I of the research and development with the department of engineering at Florida International University.
 
It is my sincerely hope that you can lead me in the appropriate direction so that this worthwhile project can become a reality, and benefit the citizens of Florida.
 
Sincerely,
 
 
Ira M. Baum, D.P.M.

-----Original Message----- 
From: Daniel Bolton [mailto:dan_bolton@worldnet.att.net] 
Sent: Friday, May 17, 2002 6:32 PM 
To: Jeb Bush 
Subject: Computers for Schools and Digital Divide 


Dear Governor, 
  
I had sent you some information regarding our charitable technology 
program called LEAP last fall at the request of several Senators and 
Cheryl Cliett, the teacher in residence. You responded and thought it 
was an interesting idea and were turning things over to the Secretary's 
and Commissioner's office for follow up. 
  
My organization did get a response back from a middle level DOE person 
that I had already spoken with. I was never afforded the opportunity to 
discuss the program and its potential strategic importance in solving 
the obsolete technology and Digital Divide problems existing with in our 
state's public schools and underprivileged communities with Secretary 
Horne or Commissioner Crist. 
  
I am going to give this one more try before we eliminate the state of 
Florida as a partner in this effort. Please review the information 
provided in the attached letter (revised 5/16/02). The idea we speak of 
has the power to assist the many charitable efforts hoping to improve 
technology-based learning in poor communities and to help schools 
replace aging equipment via a cost effective and efficient process. 
  
My organization is offering to help Florida build a program that over 
the next ten years will deliver at least $24,000,000 in direct net 
benefit and help hundreds of thousands of children receive a better 
education. 
  
If after review of this information there is interest to discuss things 
further I would enjoy meeting with you or the Lt. Governor to explain 
things further. Thank you! 
  
Sincerely, 
  
Dan Bolton 
Executive Director 
Angels Helping Hands Foundation 
407-862-3434 
dan_bolton@att.net

From:	Howard <howdee@ij.net>

Subject:	Cervical Cancer and Medical Insurance

Dear Elected Representatives: My wife Dee, whose family has a history of dire results from cervical cancer, recently had her 6-month checkup "to rule out cervical cancer" as the doctors would say. She is covered for medical insurance as the "dependent" of a Retired State Employee under my Blue Cross/Blue Shield PPO. 
My concern for your due diligence is that Pap Smears and CA-125 blood tests are not covered by medical insurance because they are considered "routine". And my question for you and your wives and dependent daughters is: What the H..l is "routine" about cervical cancer and the tests to "rule it out"? I am not sure that a sonogram to "rule out breast cancer" is considered "routine", so I did not include it. Ask your wives. Thanks for your consideration of my questions. 
Very Truly Yours, 
Howard M. Raymond

By the way, another reason to love the NGA (and i'm just kidding) . . . . .
. I get their weekly best practices email on friday, kind of spanning the
globe for "good policy" each week.  However, and it does not go unnoticed to
afficionados like me, every week the NGA manages to include links to a few
reports done not by states but by think tanks --- and this is a good example
below -- notice who the think tanks are that get their reports on this email
and just in this one issue -- the Brookings Institute; Pew Oceans
Commission; the Urban Institute -- I've never seen a Heritage Foundation
paper linked here!!!!!!!

So again, when we pay dues to NGA, we are funding an organization not only
to make liberal policy, but to promote liberal think tanks.   Just more food
for thought.

About the Center
The NGA Center for Best Practices helps Governors and their key policy staff
develop and implement innovative solutions to governance and policy
challenges facing them in their states.
Through the staff of the Center, Governors and their policy advisors can:
*       quickly learn about what works, what doesn't, and what lessons can
be learned from others grappling with the same problems;

*       obtain assistance in designing and implementing new programs or in
making current programs more effective; and

*       receive up-to-date information about what is happening in other
state capitals and in Washington, D.C., so Governors are better prepared to
react to emerging issues.

Task Force
Washington D.C.

VIA E-MAIL:  letters@sun-sentinel.com <mailto:letters@sun-sentinel.com>
VIA FAX:  954/356-4612
Letters to the Editor
Sun-Sentinel
200 E. Las Olas Blvd.
Ft. Lauderdale, FL  33301


Your May 11 column, "Jury's still out on who's running agency," misses the
point about our response to the Rilya Wilson tragedy.

It is not about what the "Tallahassee crowd" thinks or doesn't think.  It is
about a missing child.

It is not about who is "off-camera" and who is on.  It is about a missing
child.

Rilya Wilson's story illustrates that while child welfare in Florida is much
improved, we still have a long way to go.  Our doubling of funding over four
years has helped.  More caseworkers have helped.  Innovative programs such
as community-based care have helped.  But we still have a long way to go.

Countless DCF employees, led by Secretary Kearney, perform their jobs with
the greatest integrity and commitment.  They are not "on-camera" as much as
I am because I am the Governor.

But out in front or behind the scenes, all of us are working together to
ensure the safety of every Florida child in our care.  We are doing a better
job.  We are committed to doing better still.  With the continued support of
concerned Floridians, we will.



Sincerely,



Jeb Bush


Mark Busse
Chief Speechwriter
Office of Governor Jeb Bush

whether or not she can reside with Ms Kaminski as a roomate.
